summary: This appears to be an email from a Correctional Service Administrator at the Federal Bureau of Prisons Northeast Regional Office, transmitting a document titled 'New York Roster Break Down' with corrections to names. The document is likely related to inmate or personnel records in the New York area, possibly connected to Epstein's incarceration or related investigations.

persons.name: M INIIIM
persons.context: Appears as the sender of an email transmitting a document titled 'New York Roster Break Down' with name corrections.

events.title: Email transmission of New York Roster document
events.description: An email was sent transmitting a document titled 'New York Roster Break Down' with corrections to names, from a Correctional Service Administrator at the Federal Bureau of Prisons.

locations: Northeast Regional Office (Federal Bureau of Prisons)
keyFacts: The document is an email dated August 12, 2019, sent by 'M INIIIM'.
The email transmits an attachment titled 'New York Roster Break Down.docx' with corrections to names.
The sender is identified as a Correctional Service Administrator at the Federal Bureau of Prisons Northeast Regional Office.
The document suggests official record-keeping or roster management related to New York, possibly in a correctional context.
The timing (August 2019) coincides with Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death in a New York federal facility.
